param.name: pBorderColor
param.para: A pointer to an structure that specifies the border color as an ARGB (alpha, red, green, blue) value.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Specifies the amount of downsampling to perform on the output.

param.name: pConstrictionSize
param.para: To disable constriction, set this parameter to NULL.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Sets the destination rectangle. The destination rectangle is the portion of the output surface where the source rectangle is blitted.

param.name: pDstRect
param.para: A pointer to a structure that specifies the destination rectangle.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: See Video Processor MFT for info regarding source and destination rectangles in the Video Processor MFT.

summary.para: Specifies whether to flip the video image.

param.name: eMirror
param.para: An value that specifies whether to flip the video image, either horizontally or vertically.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Specifies whether to rotate the video to the correct orientation.

param.name: eRotation
param.para: A value that specifies whether to rotate the image.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: The original orientation of the video is specified by the MF_MT_VIDEO_ROTATION attribute of the input media type.

If eRotation is ROTATION_NONE, the video processor does not correct the orientation of the output video. If the original video is rotated, and eRotation is ROTATION_NORMAL, the video processor corrects the orientation, so that the output video is not rotated. The video processor letterboxes the output as needed.

summary.para: Sets the source rectangle. The source rectangle is the portion of the input frame that is blitted to the destination surface.

param.name: pSrcRect
param.para: A pointer to a structure that specifies the source rectangle.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: See Video Processor MFT for info regarding source and destination rectangles in the Video Processor MFT.
This interface controls how the Video Processor MFT generates output frames.
